intro: Urbanella, commonly known as the common thyme, is a low-growing herbaceous plant belonging to the Lamiaceae family. It is characterized by its aromatic, small, opposite leaves and clusters of pink or white flowers. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia but has been naturalized in various regions, including North America. Urbanella thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its compact growth habit and fragrant foliage make it a popular choice for both ornamental and culinary purposes.
